qas.question: What was the vacuum created by the mercury displacement pump?

answers.text: partial vacuum of about 10 Pa (0.1 Torr).

qas.question: What year was the Toepler Pump invented?
What was first invented by Otto von Guericke ?
What was made visible at a partial vacuum of 10 Pa?
What was invented by Robert Boyle in 1654?
What was the famous experiment called that Robert Boyle conducted?

plausible_answers.text: a partial vacuum of about 10 Pa (0.1 Torr)

qas.question: What type of vacuum did Robert Boyle achieve in 1855?
What did Heinrich Geissler help Otto von Guericke further develop?
In what year did Otto von Guericke invent the mercury displacement pump?

context: In 1654, <a3_0>Otto von Guericke<a3_0/> invented <b5_0>the first <a2_0>vacuum pump<b5_0/><a2_0/> and conducted his famous <b6_0>Magdeburg hemispheres experiment<b6_0/>, showing that teams of horses could not separate two hemispheres from which the air had been partially evacuated. Robert Boyle improved Guericke's design and with the help of Robert Hooke further developed <b8_0>vacuum pump technology<b8_0/>. Thereafter, research into the partial vacuum lapsed until <a1_0>1850<a1_0/> when August Toepler invented the Toepler Pump and Heinrich Geissler invented the mercury displacement pump in <b9_0>1855<b9_0/>, achieving <b7_0>a <a0_0>partial vacuum of about 10 Pa (0.1 Torr)<b7_0/>.<a0_0/> <a4_0>A number of electrical properties<a4_0/> become observable at this vacuum level, which renewed interest in further research.
